description: Triangle T(n,k)r read by rows, giving the number of n X n binary matrices with no zero rows or columns and with k=0..n^2 ones.
links: H. Cheballah, S. Giraudo, R. Maurice, Combinatorial Hopf algebra structure on packed square matrices, arXiv preprint arXiv:1306.6605, 2013
R. Tauraso, Edge cover time for regular graphs, JIS 11 (2008) 08.4.4
formula: Number of m X n binary matrices with no zero rows or columns and with k=0..m*n ones is Sum_{i=0..n} (-1)^i*C(n, i)*a(m, n-i, k) where a(m, n, k)=Sum_{i=0..m} (-1)^i*C(m, i)*C((m-i)*n, k).G.f. for n-th row: Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^(n-k)*binomial(n, k)*((1+x)^k-1)^n. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 04 2003E.g.f.: Sum(((1+y)^n-1)^n*exp((1-(1+y)^n)*x)*x^n/n!,n=0..infinity). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 24 2008
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jun 01 2000
